## HUB vs PAYG

We want to create a visual that displays the amount of cost and vCores that are covered by HUB vs PAYG, both for VMs and SQL instances.

Tasks to complete to achieve the above goal:

- Identify all cost related to VM/SQL
- Determine if cost is covered by HUB or PAYG
- Identify instances that are covered by RI, and take that into consideration

Exclude CVD from resource name _CVD-_

PAYG = compute + license - for a cost item

RI instances have MeterCategory of Virtual Machines Lincenses - only one cost item per instance

Non-RI --> always two cost items per instances --> linux cost of the same VM away from the windows cost item cost - CostInBillingCurrency
import pyspark.sql.functions as F
from enum import Enum
storageAccount = 's037costmgmt'

class HUBCategory(Enum):
    VM_RI_HUB = "VM - RI enabled - HUB enabled"
    VM_RI_nHUB = "VM - RI enabled - HUB disabled"
    VM_nRI_HUB = "VM - RI disabled - HUB enabled"
    VM_nRI_nHUB = "VM - RI disabled - HUB disabled"
    UNKNOWN = "Unknown"

cost_path = f'abfss://usage@{storageAccount}.dfs.core.windows.net/exports/monthly/ACMMonthlyActualCost/20231101-20231130/Extended_v3_ACMMonthlyActualCost_20231101-20231130.parquet'
# cost_path = f'abfss://usage@{storageAccount}.dfs.core.windows.net/exports/monthly/ACMMonthlyActualCost/20231101-20231130/ACMMonthlyActualCost_20231101-20231130.parquet'
df = spark.read.format('parquet').load(cost_path)

# MeterCategory  - MeterSubCategory - MeterName - Date - ProductName - EffectivePrice - CostInBillingCurrency - ConsumedService - ResourceId - PartNumber - ServiceInfo1 - ServiceInfo 2 - Azure_Hybrid_Benefit - IsRIUsage - AHB_CPUs - ai_DatabaseName - ai_vCores - ai_AHB - ai_VCPUs - aiServiceType - ai_UsageType
df = df.select(
    'Date', 
    'MeterCategory', 
    'MeterSubCategory', 
    'ResourceName',
    # 'EffectivePrice', 
    'CostInBillingCurrency',
    'Quantity',
    'UnitOfMeasure', 
    'ResourceId', 
    'ServiceInfo2', 
    'Azure_Hybrid_Benefit', 
    'IsRIUsage', 
    # 'AHB_CPUs', 
    # 'ai_DatabaseName', 
    # 'ai_vCores', 
    # 'ai_AHB', 
    'ai_VCPUs'
    # 'ai_ServiceType', 
    # 'ai_UsageType'

def get_distinct_column_values(df, column_name):
    temp = df.select(column_name).distinct()
    return [row[0] for row in temp.collect()]


def get_column_statistics(df1, df2, column_name):
    set1 = set(get_distinct_column_values(df1, column_name))
    set2 = set(get_distinct_column_values(df2, column_name))

    intersection = set1.intersection(set2)
    only_in_set1 = set1.difference(set2)
    only_in_set2 = set2.difference(set1)
    union = set1.union(set2)

    print(f"Elements only in set1: {only_in_set1}")
    print(f"Elements only in set2: {only_in_set2}")
    print(f"Elements in both sets: {union}")
## Load pricesheet

PROD_OFFER_ID = 'MS-AZR-0017P'
# pricesheet_path = f'abfss://usage@{storageAccount}.dfs.core.windows.net/pricesheet/pricesheet-20*.parquet'
pricesheet_path = f'abfss://usage@{storageAccount}.dfs.core.windows.net/pricesheet/pricesheet-LATEST.parquet'
pricesheet_df = spark.read.format('parquet').load(pricesheet_path)
pricesheet_df = pricesheet_df.where(F.col('offerId') == PROD_OFFER_ID)
pricesheet_df = pricesheet_df.withColumn('unitQuantity', F.split('unitOfMeasure', ' ')[0])
pricesheet_df = pricesheet_df.withColumn('pricePerUnit', F.col('unitPrice') / F.col('unitQuantity'))
pricesheet_df = pricesheet_df.select('meterName', 'unitOfMeasure', 'unitQuantity', 'unitPrice', 'pricePerUnit', 'billingPeriodId')

## Find VM related cost
- In savings - Check _MeterCategory_ for **Virtual Machines** (nov 2023 = 885,034) (and _SericeInfo2_ for **Windows Server BYOL** for HUB)
- In HUB daily - Check _ResourceId_ like **/virtualMachines/** or **/virtualMachineScaleSets/** (nov 2023 = 916,043) (and _MeterSubCategory_ like **Windows** for non-HUB or _SericeInfo2_ for **Windows Server BYOL** for HUB)

Extended cost file has column **Azure_Hybrid_Benefit** --> 

if _MeterSubCategory_ contains **Windows** --> HUB is **NOT** enabled

if _ServiceInfo2_ is **Windows Server BYOL** --> HUB enabled
vm_df = df.where(((F.col('ResourceId').like('%/virtualMachines/%')) | (F.col('ResourceId').like('%/virtualMachineScaleSets/%'))))
vm_df = vm_df.where((F.col('MeterSubCategory').contains('Windows')) | (F.col('ServiceInfo2') == 'Windows Server BYOL'))
vm_df = vm_df.where(~F.col('ResourceName').like('CVD-%'))

'Date', 
    'MeterCategory', 
    'MeterSubCategory', 
    'ResourceName',
    # 'EffectivePrice', 
    'CostInBillingCurrency',
    'Quantity',
    'UnitOfMeasure', 
    'ResourceId', 
    'ServiceInfo2', 
    'Azure_Hybrid_Benefit', 
    'IsRIUsage',

vm_df = vm_df \
    .select('ai_VCPUs', 'Date', 'Quantity', 'MeterCategory', 'MeterSubCategory', 'ResourceName', 'CostInBillingCurrency', 'Azure_Hybrid_Benefit', 'IsRIUsage', 'UnitOfMeasure') \
    .groupBy('Date', 'ResourceName', 'Azure_Hybrid_Benefit', 'MeterCategory', 'MeterSubCategory', 'ai_VCPUs', 'IsRIUsage', 'UnitOfMeasure') \
    .agg(F.sum('Quantity').alias('Quantity'), F.sum('CostInBillingCurrency').alias('ResourceCost')) \
    .orderBy('Date', 'Quantity', 'ResourceCost')

vm_df = vm_df.where(F.col('ai_VCPUs') != 0)
vm_df = vm_df.withColumn('pricesheetService', F.concat(
    F.lit('Windows Server'),
    F.when(F.col('MeterSubCategory') == 'Windows Server Burst', ' Burst - ').otherwise(' - '), 
    F.col('ai_VCPUs'), 
    F.lit(' vCPU VM License')

vm_df = vm_df.join(pricesheet_df, pricesheet_df.meterName == vm_df.pricesheetService, "left")
vm_df = vm_df.drop('priceSheetService')

vm_df = vm_df.withColumn('PAYGLicenseCost', F.col('Quantity') * F.col('pricePerUnit'))

vm_df = vm_df.withColumn('HUBCategory',
    F.when((F.col('IsRIUsage') == 'RI Usage') & (F.col('Azure_Hybrid_Benefit') == 'Enabled'), HUBCategory.VM_RI_HUB.value)
    .when((F.col('MeterCategory') == 'Virtual Machines Licenses') & (F.col('MeterSubCategory').like('Windows Server%')), HUBCategory.VM_RI_nHUB.value)
    .when((F.col('IsRIUsage') == 'On Demand Usage') == (F.col('Azure_Hybrid_Benefit') == 'Enabled'), HUBCategory.VM_nRI_HUB.value)
    .when((F.col('IsRIUsage') == 'On Demand Usage') == (F.col('Azure_Hybrid_Benefit') == 'Not Enabled'), HUBCategory.VM_nRI_nHUB.value)
    .otherwise(HUBCategory.UNKNOWN.value)

vm_df = vm_df.withColumn('CostWithHub', 
    F.when((F.col('HUBCategory') == HUBCategory.VM_nRI_HUB.value) | (F.col('HUBCategory') == HUBCategory.VM_RI_HUB.value), F.col('ResourceCost'))
    .when((F.col('HUBCategory') == HUBCategory.VM_nRI_nHUB.value) | (F.col('HUBCategory') == HUBCategory.VM_RI_nHUB.value), F.col('ResourceCost') - F.col('PAYGLicenseCost'))
    .otherwise(None)
)

vm_df = vm_df.withColumn('UnlockedSavings', F.when((F.col('HUBCategory') == HUBCategory.VM_RI_HUB.value) | (F.col('HUBCategory') == HUBCategory.VM_nRI_HUB.value), F.col('PAYGLicenseCost')).otherwise(0))
vm_df = vm_df.withColumn('PotentialSavings', F.col('ResourceCost') - F.col('CostWithHub'))
vm_df = vm_df.drop('UnitOfMeasure', 'unitQuantity', 'unitPrice', 'pricePerUnit')
hub_path = f"abfss://usage@{storageAccount}.dfs.core.windows.net/hub/windows-vm-hub.parquet"
vm_df.write.format('parquet').mode('overwrite').option('overwriteSchema', 'true').save(hub_path)

Create these categories for VM cost
- RI VM cost (only license cost)
- HUB (non-RI) cost (only compute cost / no license)
- PAYG (non-RI) cost (compute + license) 

| HUB cost | PAYG cost | License cost |
| -------- | --------- | ------------ |
| [HUB] Cost or [PAYG] Cost - License | [HUB] Cost + License or [PAYG] Cost | lookup pricesheet |

PAYG = compute + license - for a cost item

RI instances have MeterCategory of Virtual Machines Lincenses - only one cost item per instance

Non-RI --> always two cost items per instances --> linux cost of the same VM away from the windows cost item cost - CostInBillingCurrency

#### Comparing the two following queries

1. _ResourceId_ includes **/virtualMachines/** or **/virtualMachineScaleSets/** (dataset1)
2. _MeterCategory_ is **Virtual Machines** or **Virtual Machines Licenses** (dataset2)

Note: both queries also checks that _MeterSubCategory_ includes **Windows** or _ServiceInfo2_ is **Windows Server BYOL** to only account for Windows VMs

Based on the queries above, the resulting counts for november 2023 where:

1. 135,453 cost items
2. 136,203 cost items

There is a small difference between these two subsets.

Analysis of certain dataset columns yielded the following results:

**MeterSubCategory** column in dataset2 includes the following values that are not present in dataset1
- Av2 Series Windows
- Ev3/ESv3 Series Windows

**ProductName** column in dataset2 includes the following values that are not present in dataset1
- Virtual Machines Ev3/ESv3 Series Windows - E4 v3/E4s v3 - EU North
- Virtual Machines Av2 Series Windows - A1 v2 - NO East
- Virtual Machines F/FS Series Windows - F8/F8s - EU North

**MeterName** column in dataset2 includes the following values that are not present in dataset1
- A1 v2

**ai_ServiceType** column in dataset2 includes the following values that are not present in dataset1
- Standard_A1_v2
- Standard_F8
- Standard_E4_v3

After further inspection of the above dataset differences, all related costs to the odd values for columns in dataset2, they have the following facts in common:

- Very small subset of cost
- All are PAYG cost (no HUB enabled)
- The resource id of all these costs have the form: /subscriptions/df89af9f-9074-40b4-a620-1d35c0eea0a4/resourceGroups/rg-observability-dev/providers/Microsoft.Batch/batchAccounts/baobservabilitydev/pools/poolobservabilitydev
- All costs are associated with Microsoft.Batch consumed service type

This is why it is not covered by the dataset that requires virtualMachines or virtualMachineScaleSets to be part of the resource identifier
